body: Nassirou Diallo and Mohamed Keita discuss the struggle to control the media in Cote d'Ivoire: "Cut off from the state media, Ouattara's self-proclaimed government uses the international media and an improvised radio station to make itself heard.
original_body: Nassirou Diallo and Mohamed Keita discuss the struggle to control the media in Cote d'Ivoire: "Cut off from the state media, Ouattara's self-proclaimed government uses the international media and an improvised radio station to make itself heard.
title: Cote d'Ivoire: The struggle to control media
